item.title: Register a new hook
item.description: How to register a new Hook in PrestaShop This is basically three steps: dispatch the hook in the code (in templates or PHP classes/files); update the hooks xml definition of Installer; update the hooks table for “Auto Upgrade” system; Dispatching hooks Most of the time, you will dispatch the hook using an instance of HookDispatcher. item.title: Symfony bridge for hooks
item.description: Symfony bridge for hooks In Back-Office, migrated pages are powered by Symfony. The powerful Symfony Event Dispatcher has been chosen to replace, in the long term, hooks. However, in order to preserve backward compatibility, both systems coexist in 1.7. It is important that modules which subscribe to a hook are correctly notified no matter where the hook is dispatched from, be it in legacy code or modern code. In legacy code, hooks are dispatched using Hook::exec().
